{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this scenario, we are preparing a Class II cavity on a maxillary first molar. We need to identify which pulp horns are likely to get exposed. The morphology of the tooth and the location of the cavity suggest that the mesiolingual and distobuccal pulp horns are at risk of exposure. This is because the Class II cavity involves removing enamel and dentin on both the mesial and distal surfaces, but not on the buccal surface.", "answer_choice": "C"}
